info.title: Claim API
info.description: APIs for claims and related objects

post.summary: Issue multiple requests at once as a non-transactional batch
post.description: Post a list of subrequests to make against this endpoint. Subrequests will be executed serially, in the order they are specified in the "requests" property of the input. Responses to each subrequest will then be batched up and returned all together. Subrequests inherit the headers from the main request, with the exception of the GW-Checksum header, but headers can be specified on the subrequest and will override any headers from the main request.

parameters.name: includeResponseHeaders
parameters.description: Controls what response headers, if any, are included for subresponses. If unspecified, or set to the value "*all", all headers for subresponses will be returned. If set to the value "*none", no headers for subresponses will be returned. Otherwise, this parameter can consist of a comma-separated list of the names of headers that should be included on subresponses.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body of the batch request

200.description: The batch request itself was well-formed; individual subrequests may have succeeded or failed

enablePolymorphism.name: enablePolymorphism
enablePolymorphism.description: Whether or not to use the `discriminator`/`oneOf` pattern to output schemas in cases where the valid set of fields can vary based on some attribute of the data such as the country or subtype.  Defaults to `true`. See the documentation for more information.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Allows the caller to specify the set of fields that should be included on the response. This can be used to limit the set of fields returned as well as to include optional fields that otherwise wouldn't normally be returned. The parameter is either of the form `fields=<field list>` or `fields=<include>:<field list>`, where `<field list>` consists of a comma-separated list of field or field set names. See the documentation for more information.

filter.name: filter
filter.description: Filters the list of results based on the specified field, operator, and value. The parameter is either of the form `filter=<field>:<operator>:<value>` or `filter=<include>:<field>:<operator>:<value>`. See the documentation for more information.

filterByUser.name: filterByUser
filterByUser.description: Whether or not to filter endpoints and schema properties by the authorization of the caller. Defaults to `false`.

gwLanguageHeader.name: GW-Language
gwLanguageHeader.description: If specified, this header will set the language used when processing the request

gwLocaleHeader.name: GW-Locale
gwLocaleHeader.description: If specified, this header will set the locale used when processing the request

gwSchemaProperty.name: GW-IncludeSchemaProperty
gwSchemaProperty.description: If specified and the operation returns json with a defined schema, this will add a property, '$GW-Schema',  with the fully qualified name of the object's schema.

gwTraceability.name: X-Correlation-ID
gwTraceability.description: This header permits a customer to trace a request from its initial reception through all of the subsequent applications that were invoked to handle that request. The actual traceability id present in the MDC and logs (and returned in the response), is dependent on the implementation of TraceabilityIDPlugin. The default implementation uses this value, if specified, or a generated UID.  However, another implementation may always generate a unique id and just log  the relationship between these incoming values and the generated UID. Note: that this header can be repeated, but the resulting string will just be the comma separated values.

gwTransactionID.name: GW-DBTransaction-ID
gwTransactionID.description: If specified and this operation results in a database commit, this header's value must not have been submitted before.  This value must be globally unique across all clients, apis and webservices. It is used for those transaction that are not idempotent. Unless this is explicitly referenced for an operation it is not required.

gwUnknownPropertyHeader.name: GW-UnknownPropertyHandling
gwUnknownPropertyHeader.description: If specified, this header will drive the behavior for unknown property handling

gwUnknownQueryParameterHeader.name: GW-UnknownQueryParamHandling
gwUnknownQueryParameterHeader.description: If specified, this header will drive the behavior for unknown query parameter handling.  Default is to reject them.

gwValidateResponseHandling.name: GW-ValidateResponseHandling
gwValidateResponseHandling.description: If specified, this header permits the client to override the behavior around validating response

include.name: include
include.description: Used to request that additional resources be returned with the API response in the `included` section of the responses. The `include` parameter can appear multiple times, and is a comma-separated list of additional resources to include. See the documentation for more information.

includeTotal.name: includeTotal
includeTotal.description: Used to request that results should include a count of the total number of results available, which may be more than the total number of results currently being returned. This parameter is of the form `includeTotal=<true|false>` or `includeTotal=<include>:<true|false>`. If not specified, the default is considered to be `false`. See the documentation for more information about response pagination.

locationBasedRiskUnitId.name: locationBasedRiskUnitId
locationBasedRiskUnitId.description: The identifier for the location based risk unit

omitInclusions.name: omitInclusions
omitInclusions.description: Whether or not to omit the `included` properties on request and response schemas.  Defaults to `false`. See the documentation for more information. (Since 1.4.0)

pageOffset.name: pageOffset
pageOffset.description: The offset of the first result to fetch when fetching a paginated set of results. The parameter is of the form `pageOffset=<number>` where the first result has an offset of 0. For example, `pageOffset=25` will skip the first 25 results in sorted order. If not specified, the default value is 0. See the documentation for more information about response pagination.

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response. The parameter is of the form `pageSize=<size>` or `pageSize=<include>:<size>`. The maximum allowed `pageSize` and the default `pageSize` both depend on the specific API endpoint the request is made to. See the documentation for more information about response pagination.

prettyPrintSchema.name: prettyPrint
prettyPrintSchema.description: Whether or not to pretty-print the returned schema, making it larger but more human readable.  Defaults to `false`.

propertyContentsIncidentId.name: propertyContentsIncidentId
propertyContentsIncidentId.description: The REST identifier for the property contents incident (Since 1.4.0)

recoveryReserveSetId.name: recoveryReserveSetId
recoveryReserveSetId.description: The identifier for the recovery reserve set (Since 1.3.0)

recoverySetId.name: recoverySetId
recoverySetId.description: The identifier for the recovery set (Since 1.3.0)

reserveSetId.name: reserveSetId
reserveSetId.description: The identifier for the reserve set (Since 1.3.0)

sort.name: sort
sort.description: Controls the sorting of elements within a response. The sort parameter is of the form `sort=<fields>` or `sort=<include>:<fields>`, where `<fields>` represents a comma-separated list of field names to sort on. Field names can be prefixed with `-` to request a descending sort, otherwise the sort will be ascending. See the documentation for more information.

vehicleRiskUnitId.name: vehicleRiskUnitId
vehicleRiskUnitId.description: The identifier for the vehicle risk unit

AuthenticationError.description: 401 error that is returned if the request's user cannot be authenticated

BadInput.description: 400 error that is returned if the input to this endpoint is not valid; this can happen because of missing required parameters, malformed json, json that does not validate against the declared schema, etc.

InternalServerError.description: 500 error that is returned if a server-side error prevented this request from being processed

NotAcceptable.description: 406 error that is returned if the Accept header provided by the client does not match any types produced by this endpoint

NotAuthorized.description: 403 error that is returned if the authenticated user is not authorized to access a given resource

NotFound.description: 404 error that is returned if the specified resource does not exist

OperationNotSupported.description: 405 error that is returned if the specified HTTP verb is not allowed on a given resource

ServiceUnavailable.description: 503 error that is returned if the server's runlevel is not adequate to service this request

UnsupportedContentType.description: 415 error that is returned if the Content-Type of the request is not consumable by this endpoint

BatchRequest.title: Batch request
BatchRequest.description: The body of a batch request

BatchResponse.title: Batch response
BatchResponse.description: The body of a response to a batch request. The `responses` field will have one element for every entry in the `requests` field on the request, and responses will appear in the same order.

responses.title: Responses
responses.description: The list of subresponses, appearing in the same order as the elements in the `requests` field of the request

BatchSubRequest.title: Batch subrequest
BatchSubRequest.description: An individual subrequest within a batch request

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Headers that will be included as part of the subrequest. Any headers defined using this field will override header values inherited from the main request. Any headers present on the main request that are not defined in this list will be inherited when the subrequest is made, with the exception of the `GW-Checksum` header.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method for the subrequest

onFail.title: On fail
onFail.description: Controls whether or not subsequent subrequests are processed if this subrequest fails. The default behavior is to continue processing subrequests. The `abort` option specifies that all subsequent subrequests will be skipped.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path for the subrequest. This path is relative to the root of the API hosting the batch endpoint. For example, if the batch endpoint is `<servlet>/rest/common/v1/batch`, then a path of `/activities` will mean a request against `<servlet>/rest/common/v1/activities`. The path must start with `/` and cannot contain whitespace.

query.title: Query
query.description: The query string to use for the subrequest

BatchSubResponse.title: Batch subresponse
BatchSubResponse.description: A subresponse to a batch subrequest

code.title: Code
code.description: The HTTP status code for the subresponse

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: The headers returned for the subresponse

skipped.title: Skipped
skipped.description: A `true` value indicates that the corresponding subrequest was not processed due to a prior failed request that specified the `onFail` field with the `abort` option

Header.title: Header
Header.description: An HTTP request or response header

Activity.title: Activity
Activity.description: An `Activity` is an assignable item that represents a task to be done, a decision to be made, or information to be aware of

activityPattern.title: Activity pattern
activityPattern.description: The code of the `ActivityPattern` used to create this activity and set its initial values

activityType.title: Activity type
activityType.description: The type of this activity, such as `general` or `approval`

approvalIssue.title: Approval issue
approvalIssue.description: The reason approval is needed. Only applicable to activities with an `activityType` of `approval`.

approvalRationale.title: Approval rationale
approvalRationale.description: Rationale for approving or rejecting this activity. Only applicable to activities with an `activityType` of `approval`.

approved.title: Approved
approved.description: This field is `true` if this activity has been approved, `false` if this activity has been rejected, and omitted otherwise. Only applicable to activities with an `activityType` of `approval`.

assignedByUser.title: Assigned by user
assignedByUser.description: A reference to the `User` who last assigned or re-assigned this activity

assignedGroup.title: Assigned group
assignedGroup.description: A reference to the `Group` that this activity is currently assigned to

assignedQueue.title: Assigned queue
assignedQueue.description: A reference to the `Queue` that this activity is currently assigned to

assignedUser.title: Assigned user
assignedUser.description: A reference to the `User` that this activity is currently assigned to

assignmentStatus.title: Assignment status
assignmentStatus.description: The current assignment status of this activity, such as `assigned` or `unassigned`

autopilotHandlingDecision.title: Autopilot handling decision
autopilotHandlingDecision.description: Record of the decision made around how to handle this activity. Only intended for use if Claims Autopilot is enabled. (Since 1.2.0)

autopilotId.title: Autopilot ID
autopilotId.description: Unique identifier assigned to this activity by the Claims Autopilot system. Only intended for use by the Claims Autopilot system. (Since 1.2.0)

autopilotPurpose.title: Autopilot purpose
autopilotPurpose.description: Activity purpose set by the Claims Autopilot system. Only intended for use by the Claims Autopilot system. (Since 1.2.0)

closeDate.title: Close date
closeDate.description: The date and time when this activity was completed, skipped, approved, or rejected

closeUser.title: Close user
closeUser.description: A reference to the `User` that completed, skipped, approved, or rejected this activity

coverageIssues.title: Coverage issues
coverageIssues.description: A list of possible issues with coverage for the associated claim (Since 1.2.0)

createTime.title: Create time
createTime.description: The date and time when this `Activity` was created (Since 1.1.0)

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of this activity

dueDate.title: Due date
dueDate.description: Date and time by which a person should complete the activity. If not completed by this time, the activity is considered overdue. Not applicable to activities that represent events rather than tasks.

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: Date and time at which the activity is expected to end. Only applicable to activities that represent events.

escalated.title: Escalated
escalated.description: A `true` value for this field indicates that the activity has been escalated

escalationDate.title: Escalation date
escalationDate.description: Date and time at which this activity will be escalated if it has not yet been completed

externallyOwned.title: Externally owned
externallyOwned.description: A `true` value for this field indicates that the activity is owned by a user or group outside of the insurer

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this `Activity`

importance.title: Importance
importance.description: Level of importance of the activity

initialAssignment.title: Initial assignment
initialAssignment.description: The `Assignee` that this activity should be assigned to when it is first created

mandatory.title: Mandatory
mandatory.description: A `true` value for this field indicates that the activity is mandatory and cannot be skipped

recurring.title: Recurring
recurring.description: A `true` value indicates that this activity is recurring

relatedTo.title: Related to
relatedTo.description: A reference to the primary element that the activity is related to (Since 1.3.0)

startDate.title: Start date
startDate.description: Date and time at which the activity is scheduled to begin. Only applicable to activities that represent events.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of this activity, such as `open` or `complete`

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: A brief title for the activity

ActivityPattern.title: Activity pattern
ActivityPattern.description: An `ActivityPattern` is a template for an activity, and is used to create a new activity and set defaults for some of its fields

activityClass.title: Activity class
activityClass.description: The class of activity that this activity pattern creates, such as `task` or `event`

activityType.title: Activity type
activityType.description: The type of activity that this activity pattern creates, such as `general` or `approval`

availableForClosedClaims.title: Available for closed claims
availableForClosedClaims.description: A `true` value for this field indicates that this activity pattern can be used to create activities on closed claims

category.title: Category
category.description: The category of the activity pattern. Used to help organize `ActivityPatterns` when presenting them to a user.

claimLossType.title: Claim loss type
claimLossType.description: A claim loss type for this pattern. Used to allow filtering activity patterns based on the loss type of the associated claim.

code.title: Code
code.description: The code that uniquely identifies this `ActivityPattern`

description.title: Description
description.description: The default `description` for activities created from this activity pattern

dueDate.title: Due date
dueDate.description: The default `dueDate` for activities created from this activity pattern, calculated based on the current date and time

escalationDate.title: Escalation date
escalationDate.description: The default `escalationDate` for activities created from this activity pattern, calculated based on the current date and time

externallyOwned.title: Externally owned
externallyOwned.description: The default `externallyOwned` value for activities created from this activity pattern

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this `ActivityPattern`

importance.title: Importance
importance.description: The default `importance` value for activities created from this activity pattern

mandatory.title: Mandatory
mandatory.description: The default `mandatory` value for activities created from this activity pattern

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The default `priority` for activities created from this activity pattern

recurring.title: Recurring
recurring.description: The default `recurring` value for activities created from this activity pattern

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: The default `subject` for activities created from this activity pattern

AdditionalInfo.title: Additional info
AdditionalInfo.description: A name and value that defines an additional property of a contact role constraint, such as what loss types the constraint applies to

Address.title: Address
Address.description: An `Address` represents a postal address. The fields available on an `Address` will depend upon the `country` value for the `Address`.

CEDEX.title: CEDEX
CEDEX.description: The CEDEX bureau of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

addressLine1.title: Address line 1
addressLine1.description: The first line of the address

addressLine1Kanji.title: Address line 1 kanji
addressLine1Kanji.description: The kanji version of the first line of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

addressLine2.title: Address line 2
addressLine2.description: The second line of the address

addressLine2Kanji.title: Address line 2 kanji
addressLine2Kanji.description: The kanji version of the second line of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

addressLine3.title: Address line 3
addressLine3.description: The third line of the address

area.title: Area
area.description: The area of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

cityKanji.title: City kanji
cityKanji.description: The kanji version of the city of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country of the address. The value of the `country` field will affect which other fields on the `Address` are applicable.

county.title: County
county.description: The county of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

department.title: Department
department.description: The department of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the address (Since 1.2.0)

displayName.title: Display name
displayName.description: The formatted value of the address represented by this `Address`, including all standard fields for the address's country

emirate.title: Emirate
emirate.description: The emirate of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this `Address`

island.title: Island
island.description: The island of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

oblast.title: Oblast
oblast.description: The oblast of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

parish.title: Parish
parish.description: The parish of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

postalCode.title: Postal code
postalCode.description: The postal code of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

prefecture.title: Prefecture
prefecture.description: The prefecture of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

province.title: Province
province.description: The province of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

spatialPoint.title: Spatial point
spatialPoint.description: The latitude and longitude of this address, if it has been geocoded (Since 1.2.0)

state.title: State
state.description: The state of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

validUntil.title: Valid until
validUntil.description: The date and time that the address is valid until (Since 1.2.0)

amountAfterLimit.title: Amount after limit
amountAfterLimit.description: The amount payable on the item(s)

dateAcquired.title: Date acquired
dateAcquired.description: Date when this item was acquired

description.title: Description
description.description: Assessment line

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this element

incidentOrder.title: Incident order
incidentOrder.description: Order of the item on the Incident

category.title: Category
category.description: The categorization of the score. For example, a fraud system may use low_risk, medium_risk, high_risk. A total loss evaluation system may use repairable, total_loss.

exposure.title: Exposure
exposure.description: A reference to the `Exposure` that this assessment summary is associated with

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this element

normalizedScore.title: Normalized score
normalizedScore.description: The raw score mapped into the range 0-100. For example, a raw score of 320 out of 400 could map on a normalized score of 80.

rawAssessmentReferenceId.title: Raw assessment reference ID
rawAssessmentReferenceId.description: Reference ID to the raw assessment response

recommendedActionCode.title: Recommended action code
recommendedActionCode.description: A code corresponding to the recommended action, such as "request_witness_statement", "block_payment", "initiate_recovery", "offer_cash_settlement". This code could be used in business rules.

recommendedActionDescription.title: Recommended action description
recommendedActionDescription.description: A human readable description of the recommended action, such as "Take a recorded statement from the witness"

scoreDate.title: Score date
scoreDate.description: The date and time the external system scored the `Claim` or `Exposure`

scorePercentile.title: score percentile
scorePercentile.description: A value corresponding to where the score lies in the distribution of scores, as determined by the external system

tapSubtypeId.title: TAP subtype ID
tapSubtypeId.description: Designation to differentiate between distinct types of assessments. For example, line.

Assignee.title: Assignee
Assignee.description: An `Assignee` represents the target of an assignment action, such as a user/group combination, assignment queue, or automatic rule-based assignment

assigneeId.title: Assignee ID
assigneeId.description: Unique ID to reference this `Assignee` for includes (Since 1.4.0)

autoAssign.title: Auto assign
autoAssign.description: Set to `true` to indicate the assignment should be done automatically by the system. Cannot be combined with any other fields.

claimOwner.title: Claim owner
claimOwner.description: Set to `true` to indicate that the element should be assigned to the same user and group that own the element's claim

groupId.title: Group ID
groupId.description: The ID of the `Group` that the resource should be assigned to. If specified without the `userId` field, the `User` within the `Group` is selected by assignment rules. If specified along with the `userId` field, that specific `User` is assigned the element.

name.title: Name
name.description: A human-readable name for the type of assignment that this `Assignee` represents

queueId.title: Queue ID
queueId.description: The ID of the `Queue` that the resource should be assigned to. Cannot be combined with any other fields.

userId.title: User ID
userId.description: The ID of the `User` that the resource should be assigned to. The `groupId` field must also be specified if the `userId` field is specified, and the `User` must be a member of that `Group` and have permission to be assigned the element.

Building.title: Building
Building.description: A building on a policy or claim

buildingNumber.title: Building number
buildingNumber.description: The alphanumeric number assigned to this building

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this element

policySystemId.title: ID
policySystemId.description: The unique identifier of this element within the policy system

Check.title: Check
Check.description: A paper check or electronic funds transfer issued to a particular payee to deliver one or more payments (Since 1.3.0)

bankAccount.title: Bank account
bankAccount.description: The type of bank account that will be used as the source for the check

checkBatching.title: Check batching
checkBatching.description: How the check should be batched for sending

checkInstructions.title: Check instructions
checkInstructions.description: Special handling instructions for the check

checkNumber.title: Check number
checkNumber.description: The identifier for the check or the electronic funds transfer

checkType.title: Check type
checkType.description: Indicates if the check is the primary or secondary check within a check group

claimContact.title: Claim contact
claimContact.description: A reference to the `ClaimContact` that represents the claimant the check is being written to

dateOfService.title: Date of service
dateOfService.description: The date and time the service being paid for was performed, if the check is for a service

deductionType.title: Deduction type
deductionType.description: The type of deduction for a secondary check. Only applicable if `checkType` is `secondary`.

deliveryMethod.title: Delivery method
deliveryMethod.description: The requested delivery method for the check

enteredTime.title: Entered time
enteredTime.description: The date and time that the check was actually created. Note that this is not necessarily the same as the time that the `Check` element was created in the claims system.

grossAmount.title: Gross amount
grossAmount.description: The gross amount of the check, before any deductions

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this element

invoiceNumber.title: Invoice number
invoiceNumber.description: The invoice number associated with this check

issueDate.title: Issue date
issueDate.description: The date and time that the check was issued

mailTo.title: Mail to
mailTo.description: The name of the person or company that the check is mailed to

mailingAddress.title: Mailing address
mailingAddress.description: The address of the person or company that the check is mailed to

memo.title: Memo
memo.description: The memo to include on the check

payTo.title: Pay to
payTo.description: The person or company the check is made out to

payees.title: Payees
payees.description: The list of recipients of the check

paymentMethod.title: Payment method
paymentMethod.description: The requested payment method for the check

payments.title: Payments
payments.description: The list of `Transaction` elements that detail the payments included with this check

paymentsToWrite.title: Payments to create
paymentsToWrite.description: The list of `Payments` used to populate a check during creation or edit

portion.title: Portion
portion.description: The amount of the primary payment that is allocated to this secondary check. Only applicable if `checkType` is `secondary`.

reportability.title: Reportability
reportability.description: Indicates whether the check should be reported as income to the appropriate tax agency. Only applicable if `checkType` is `primary`.

reportableAmount.title: Reportable amount
reportableAmount.description: The amount of the check that should be reported as income to the appropriate tax agency, if the check is considered to be reportable

scheduledSendDate.title: Scheduled send date
scheduledSendDate.description: The date that the check is scheduled to be sent. The scheduled send date begins at the start of this date in the server's timezone.

scheduledSendDateTime.title: Scheduled send date and time
scheduledSendDateTime.description: The date and time that the check is scheduled to be sent. This is an instant that occurs at midnight in the server's time zone.

servicePdEnd.title: Service period end
servicePdEnd.description: The end date and time of the service period for the check

servicePdStart.title: Service period start
servicePdStart.description: The start date and time of the service period for the check

CheckPortion.title: Check portion
CheckPortion.description: The amount of multi-payee check that is allocated to particular secondary `Check` (Since 1.3.0)

fixedAmount.title: Fixed amount
fixedAmount.description: The fixed amount to allocate to this check. Setting this value will null out the value of the `percentage` field.

percentage.title: Percentage
percentage.description: The percentage of the overall amount to allocate to this check. Setting this value will null out the value of the `fixedAmount` field.

CheckRecurrence.title: Check recurrence
CheckRecurrence.description: Defines the recurrence schedule for a `Check` (Since 1.3.0)

firstDueDate.title: First due date
firstDueDate.description: The due date and time of the first check in the recurrence

issuanceDateOffset.title: Issuance date offset
issuanceDateOffset.description: The number of days before the due date that a check should be issued

monthlyFrequency.title: Monthly frequency
monthlyFrequency.description: The number of months between recurring checks. For example, a value of `1` will create a check every month, and a value of `3` will create a check every three months. Only applicable if `subtype` is `MonthlyCheckRecurrence`.

numChecks.title: Number of checks
numChecks.description: The number of checks in the recurrence

recurrenceDate.title: Recurrence date
recurrenceDate.description: The day of the month on which the check is due. For example, a value of `15` would result in recurring checks being due on the 15th day of the month. Only applicable if `subtype` is `MonthlyCheckRecurrence`. If `recurrenceDate` is set, `recurrenceDay` and `recurrenceWeek` should not be set.

recurrenceDay.title: Recurrence day
recurrenceDay.description: The day of the week on which the check is due

recurrenceWeek.title: Recurrence week
recurrenceWeek.description: The week of the month on which the check is due. Only applicable if `subtype` is `MonthlyCheckRecurrence`.

weeklyFrequency.title: Weekly frequency
weeklyFrequency.description: The number of weeks between recurring checks. For example, a value of `1` will create a check every week, and a value of `4` will create a check every four weeks. Only applicable if `subtype` is `WeeklyCheckRecurrence`.

CheckSet.title: Check set
CheckSet.description: A set of related checks that are submitted together for approval (Since 1.3.0)

approvalDate.title: Approval date
approvalDate.description: The date and time when this check set was approved or rejected

approvalStatus.title: Approval status
approvalStatus.description: Whether this check set has been approved, rejected, or is still awaiting approval

checks.title: Checks
checks.description: A list of references to `Check` elements that were created as part of this check set

createTime.title: Create time
createTime.description: The date and time when this `CheckSet` was created

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this element

primaryCheckToWrite.title: First primary check
primaryCheckToWrite.description: When creating a new `CheckSet`, this represents the primary check in the check set. After creation, this will be the primary check with the earliest scheduled send date, if this check set defines a recurrence.

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Details of the recurrence schedule, if this set of checks should recur

requestingUser.title: Requesting user
requestingUser.description: A reference to the `User` that represents the caller that submitted this check set for approval

secondaryChecksToWrite.title: First secondary checks
secondaryChecksToWrite.description: When creating a new `CheckSet`, this represents the list of secondary checks in the check set. After creation, this will be the secondary checks with the earliest scheduled send date, if this check set defines a recurrence.

allValidationLevelsReached.title: All validation levels reached
allValidationLevelsReached.description: The list of all the validation levels that this claim has passed (Since 1.3.0)

arson.title: Arson
arson.description: A `true` value indicates that this claim involves arson

assignedByUser.title: Assigned by user
assignedByUser.description: A reference to the `User` who last assigned or re-assigned this claim

assignedGroup.title: Assigned group
assignedGroup.description: A reference to the `Group` that this claim is currently assigned to

assignedQueue.title: Assigned queue
assignedQueue.description: A reference to the `AssignableQueue` that this claim is currently assigned to

assignedUser.title: Assigned user
assignedUser.description: A reference to the `User` that this claim is currently assigned to

assignmentStatus.title: Assignment status
assignmentStatus.description: The current assignment status of this claim, such as `assigned` or `unassigned`

claimNumber.title: Claim number
claimNumber.description: The claim number assigned to this claim

closeDate.title: Close date
closeDate.description: The date and time when this claim was closed

closedOutcome.title: Closed outcome
closedOutcome.description: The outcome reached when closing this claim

coverageInQuestion.title: Coverage in question
coverageInQuestion.description: A `true` value indicates that the claim might not be covered by the insured's policy (Since 1.2.0)

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the accident or loss

faultRating.title: Fault rating
faultRating.description: A determination of who is considered to be at fault

filterPropertyRiskUnits.title: Filter property risk units
filterPropertyRiskUnits.description: A list of `policySystemId` values for property risk units to include when retrieving the policy

filterVehicleRiskUnits.title: Filter vehicle risk units
filterVehicleRiskUnits.description: A list of `policySystemId` values for vehicle risk units to include when retrieving the policy

fireDepartmentResponded.title: Fire department responded
fireDepartmentResponded.description: A `true` value indicates that the fire department responded to the damage

fireSource.title: Fire source
fireSource.description: A description of the source of the fire that caused this claim

flagged.title: Flagged
flagged.description: Whether this claim has been flagged

hasWaterBeenTurnedOff.title: Has the water been turned off
hasWaterBeenTurnedOff.description: A `true` value indicates that the water to the house or room affected by water damage has been turned off

howWasFireDiscovered.title: How was fire discovered
howWasFireDiscovered.description: A description of how the fire that caused this claim was discovered

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this element

incidentOnly.title: Incident only
incidentOnly.description: A `true` value indicates that this claim represents an incident report only and should not be processed further

insured.title: Insured
insured.description: A reference to the `ClaimContact` that represents the insured

isAnyoneInjured.title: Is anyone injured
isAnyoneInjured.description: A `true` value indicates that someone was injured as a result of the loss

isHomeHabitable.title: Is the home habitable
isHomeHabitable.description: A `true` value indicates that the home is still habitable. Used only for claims involving damage to the insured's home.

isHomeSecure.title: Is the home secure
isHomeSecure.description: A `true` value indicates that the home is still secure. Used only for claims involving damage to the insured's home.

isRoofProtected.title: Is the roof protected
isRoofProtected.description: A `true` value indicates that water damage to the roof is covered

jurisdiction.title: Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction that covers this loss. This jurisdiction may differ from the jurisdiction in which the loss occurred.

lobCode.title: Line of business code
lobCode.description: The line of business code for the policy line this claim is made against. If the policy only contains a single line of business, this will be set automatically when the claim is created, otherwise it must be specified manually.

lossDate.title: Loss date
lossDate.description: The date and time when the loss occurred

lossType.title: Loss type
lossType.description: The type of loss represented by this claim

mainContact.title: Main contact
mainContact.description: A reference to the `ClaimContact` that represents the main contact for this claim

policyAddresses.title: Policy addresses
policyAddresses.description: A list of addresses from the policy, which can then be used to set values of other fields such as the `lossLocation`

policyNumber.title: Policy number
policyNumber.description: The policy number of the insurance policy this claim is filed against

reportedByType.title: Reported by type
reportedByType.description: The relation between the insured party and the claim reporter

reportedDate.title: Reported date
reportedDate.description: The date and time when the claim was reported

reporter.title: Main contact
reporter.description: A reference to the `ClaimContact` that represents the person who reported this claim

segment.title: Segment
segment.description: The segment assigned to this claim

siuStatus.title: SIU status
siuStatus.description: The special investigation unit status of this claim (Since 1.2.0)

smokeDamageOnly.title: Smoke damage only
smokeDamageOnly.description: A `true` value indicates that damage was caused only by smoke and not by fire

state.title: State
state.description: The status of the claim, such as `open` or `closed`

strategy.title: Strategy
strategy.description: The strategy assigned to this claim

validationLevel.title: Validation level
validationLevel.description: The validation level of this claim. If the claim `state` is `open`, edits to this claim must continue to pass this validation rules at this level and all lower validation levels.

waterSource.title: Water source

witnesses.title: Witnesses
witnesses.description: A list of witnesses relevant to this claim

ClaimAddress.title: Claim address
ClaimAddress.description: A `ClaimAddress` represents an address that appears on a claim or policy. It combines standard address fields with policy identifiers.

addressLine1.title: Address line 1
addressLine1.description: The first line of the address

addressLine2.title: Address line 2
addressLine2.description: The second line of the address

addressLine3.title: Address line 3
addressLine3.description: The third line of the address

area.title: Area
area.description: The area of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country of the address. The value of the `country` field will affect which other fields on the `ClaimAddress` are applicable.

county.title: County
county.description: The county of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

department.title: Department
department.description: The department of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

displayName.title: Display name
displayName.description: The formatted value of the address represented by this `ClaimAddress`, including all standard fields for the address's country

emirate.title: Emirate
emirate.description: The emirate of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

id.title: ID
id.description: The unique identifier of this element

island.title: Island
island.description: The island of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

oblast.title: Oblast
oblast.description: The oblast of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

parish.title: Parish
parish.description: The parish of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

policyAddress.title: Policy address
policyAddress.description: A `true` value for this field indicates that this `ClaimAddress` is part of the claim's policy and cannot be edited directly

policyLabel.title: Policy label
policyLabel.description: Describes where on the policy this address came from. Only applicable if `policyAddress` is `true`.

postalCode.title: Postal code
postalCode.description: The postal code of the address. Only applicable in certain countries.

prefecture.title: Prefecture

userId.description: The `id` of the `User` that the claim should be assigned to. The `groupId` field must also be specified if the `userId` field is specified, and the `User` must be a member of that `Group` and have permission to be assigned the element.

firstName.title: First name

homePhone.title: Home phone

lastName.title: Last name
